head.title: When the Choice Is Suffering or Death

hedline.hl1: When the Choice Is Suffering or Death

block.p: Re ''The Dutch Seek to Legalize Long-Tolerated Euthanasia'' (front page, June 20):
Re ''The Dutch Seek to Legalize Long-Tolerated Euthanasia'' (front page, June 20):
It is understandable that those suffering from unbearable pain caused by a terminal illness should want to die; we should allow their deaths.

It is depressing and no doubt horrible to have a terminal illness. But depression can be treated successfully with medication and therapy. Those who claim to know that death is to be preferred to several years of a debilitating (but not unbearably painful) illness are guilty of hubris. It is one thing for a depressed individual to commit suicide; it is quite another for our society to help her or him along with it.
DAVID W. HOGG Princeton, N.J., June 21, 2000
